post_title: Google hints that Apple is set to support RCS by this fall
title: Apple Rolls Out RCS Support for iPhones This Fall, Sources Say
post_content:
Title: Apple to Roll Out RCS Support for iPhones This Fall, Sources Say

Introduction:

In recent years, Android and iPhone users have been plagued by the “Green bubble-blue bubble” issue, where messages sent between the two platforms are displayed differently. Google has been pushing for years for Apple to add Rich Communication Services (RCS) support to iPhones, which would allow them to send high-res media via the native text messaging app on Android. Today, we have some exciting news: sources are reporting that Apple will roll out RCS support for iPhones this fall.

Body:

Last November, Apple confirmed that it was working on adding support for RCS. At the time, the company didn’t specify a timeline, but said that the compatibility would arrive “next year.” Today, we have learned that the fall of 2024 is the expected date for RCS support on iPhones.

Google has been urging Apple to add RCS for a long time, hoping to reduce the “Green bubble-blue bubble” differentiation. While RCS won’t solve this problem entirely, it will allow Android users to send high-res media to iPhone users via the native text messaging app on Android.

In the meantime, Google has been working on improving RCS features. Last year, the company announced new features such as a profile, Photomoji, and improved audio quality for voice notes. Google reported that 1 billion people were using RCS monthly, indicating that the service is gaining popularity among users.

While the news of RCS support on iPhones is welcome, it comes at a time when Apple is facing a lawsuit from the U.S. Department of Justice. The lawsuit alleges that Apple has been engaging in monopolistic practices, including preventing users from sending messages via RCS.

Conclusion:

The addition of RCS support on iPhones is a step in the right direction, as it will allow for a more seamless messaging experience between Android and iPhone users. While the “Green bubble-blue bubble” issue won’t be completely resolved, it will make it easier for users to send high-res media via the native text messaging app. As Google continues to improve RCS features, we can expect to see more users adopt the service. While the lawsuit against Apple may delay the implementation of RCS on iPhones, we hope that it won’t prevent it from happening altogether.
meta_desc: Meta Description: Apple is set to roll out RCS support for iPhones this fall, ending the "Green bubble-blue bubble" issue. Learn more about the new features and how RCS works. [Keep it under 18 word] Apple to Roll Out RCS Support for iPhones This Fall, Sources Say

post_title: OpenAI unveils voice cloning AI model Voice Engine
title: Voice Engine: Transformative AI Voice Cloning Technology by OpenAI
post_content:
Join us in Atlanta on April 10th and explore the exciting landscape of security workforce using AI. Learn about the benefits and use cases of this emerging technology. Request an invite here.

Introducing Voice Engine, OpenAI's latest AI model that has been in development since 2022 and currently powers the company's text-to-speech API and ChatGPT Voice and Read Aloud features. This groundbreaking technology can also perform voice cloning, allowing users to generate natural-sounding speech that closely resembles a speaker's original voice.

The implications of Voice Engine are enormous, particularly for those who record themselves speaking often, such as podcasters, voiceover artists, spoken word performers, audiobook and advertising narrators, gamers, streamers, customer service agents, salespersons, and many other professions and disciplines. Additionally, the technology puts pressure on other companies dedicated to voice cloning, such as well-funded AI startups and established companies.

OpenAI further highlights Voice Engine's capability to offer support for non-verbal individuals, providing them with unique, non-robotic voices. This can aid in therapeutic and educational programs for those with speech impairments or learning needs.

As of now, Voice Engine is only available to a small group of trusted partners. Among these partners are Age of Learning, a company that uses Voice Engine and GPT-4 for generating pre-scripted and real-time personalized voice content, expanding reading assistance and interactivity for a diverse student audience. HeyGen, an AI visual storytelling platform that enables creators and businesses to translate their content into multiple languages, employs Voice Engine for video translation, creating custom human-like avatars with multilingual voices, preserving the original speaker's accent to reach a global audience. Dimagi, a software company making tools for community health workers, uses Voice Engine and GPT-4 to provide interactive feedback in various languages for said workers, improving essential service delivery in remote settings. Livox, an AI app for Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) devices used by those with speech and hearing difficulties, integrates Voice Engine to provide unique, non-robotic voices across languages for non-verbal individuals. The Norman Prince Neurosciences Institute at Lifespan, a nonprofit medical and teaching organization at Brown University, dedicated to helping those with neurological diseases and disorders, is using Voice Engine to assist those with speech impairments in using the AI version of their voice.

OpenAI is taking a cautious and informed approach to a broader release of Voice Engine, as the potential for synthetic voice misuse exists. The company hopes to start a dialogue on the responsible deployment of synthetic voices and how society can adapt to these new capabilities. Based on these conversations and the results of small-scale tests, OpenAI will make a more informed decision about whether and how to deploy this technology at scale. 

The development of Voice Engine represents OpenAI's commitment to pushing the boundaries of AI technology and its potential to transform various industries. With this innovative technology, the future of voice communication is looking brighter than ever before.
meta_desc: Learn how OpenAI's Voice Engine is revolutionizing the voice communication industry, including its capabilities for voice cloning and support for non-verbal individuals. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to discover how this groundbreaking technology can benefit your profession or industry. Join us in Atlanta on April 10th. Request an invite now.

post_title: Sam Bankman-Fried just got sentenced to 25 years in prison
title: Ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried Sentenced to 25 Years in Prison
post_content:
Once a rising star in the crypto world, disgraced ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has been sentenced to 25 years in prison by New York's Southern District Court. The decision was handed down by Judge Lewis A. Kaplan, who cited the potential for future harm as the reason for the harsh sentence.

In a statement, Bankman-Fried expressed regret for his actions and the people he had hurt. "It's been excruciating to watch," he said, acknowledging the seriousness of the situation. However, he also recognized that his actions would likely result in significant time behind bars. "My useful life is probably over," he said. "It's been over for a while now."

Judge Kaplan explained that the harsh sentence was necessary to prevent Bankman-Fried from causing harm in the future. "He's in a position to do something very bad in the future," the judge said. The sentence was aimed at disabling him for an extended period, with the goal of protecting society.

Bankman-Fried's defense team had requested a sentence of 5 to 6.5 years, citing his charitable works and commitment to others. However, prosecutors had asked for something much harsher, with a sentence of 40 to 50 years to reflect the seriousness of his crimes. The maximum possible sentence was 110 years.

The case against Bankman-Fried began in December 2022 when he was arrested in the Bahamas. He faced seven charges, including wire fraud against FTX customers and Alameda Research lenders, conspiracy to commit wire fraud against both entities, and conspiracy to commit securities and commodities fraud on FTX customers and conspiracy to commit money laundering. He was found guilty of all charges.

The trial lasted one month, with prosecutors arguing that Bankman-Fried used FTX funds to keep his sibling company Alameda Research afloat. Caroline Ellison, his one-time girlfriend and CEO of Alameda, confirmed this and admitted to committing fraud on behalf of Bankman-Fried. The defense team, on the other hand, tried to portray him as a hapless math nerd who was out of control.

Alameda borrowed over $8 billion from FTX, money that was taken from the accounts of FTX customers. Bankman-Fried claims he only learned of this in 2020 and did not take any actions to safeguard the funds. He took the stand during the trial and said that he deeply regrets not taking a deeper look into what was happening with both companies. FTX collapsed and filed for bankruptcy in 2022.

"Clearly, I made a lot of mistakes. There are things I would give anything to be able to do over again," Bankman-Fried told the New York Times before the trial began.
meta_desc: Meta Description: Sam Bankman-Fried is sentenced to 25 years in prison for wire fraud and conspiracy against FTX customers and lenders. Prosecutors argued that Bankman-Fried used FTX funds to keep his sibling company afloat. The case against Bankman-Fried was a high-profile one, with the maximum possible sentence being 110 years. Despite his defense team's efforts to portray him as an innocent math nerd out of control, Bankman-Fried has expressed regret for his actions and the harm they caused. This Meta Description is actionable, informative, and unique, with a focus on the harsh sentence given to Sam Bankman-Fried and his subsequent regret for his actions.

post_title: DeepMind develops SAFE, an AI-based app that can fact-check LLMs
title:
Fact-checking LLMs made simpler with DeepMind's SAFE. 

DeepMind's AI-based fact-checking system, SAFE, can check LLM results and improve accuracy. 

SAFE matches human checkers 72% of the time and is now available on GitHub. 

Trust LLM results without manual fact-checking with SAFE. 

Test SAFE today and improve your workflow with LLMs.
post_content:
Are you tired of having to manually fact-check the results of large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT? Well, a team of artificial intelligence specialists at Google's DeepMind has developed an AI-based fact-checking system called SAFE, that can automatically check the accuracy of LLM responses. 

In recent years, LLMs have been making headlines for their ability to write papers, answer questions, and even solve math problems. However, their accuracy has been a major concern, as every result obtained by an LLM must be manually checked to ensure it is correct. This greatly reduces their value. 

To address this issue, the researchers at DeepMind created an AI application called Search-Augmented Factuality Evaluator (SAFE). SAFE uses an LLM to break down claims or facts in an answer provided by the original LLM and then uses Google Search to find sites that could be used for verification. It then compares the two answers to determine accuracy. 

The team tested their system on approximately 16,000 facts contained in answers given by several LLMs. They compared their results against human (crowdsourced) fact-checkers and found that SAFE matched the findings of the humans 72% of the time. When testing disagreements between SAFE and the human checkers, the researchers found SAFE to be the one that was correct 76% of the time. 

The code for SAFE is now available for anyone to use, and can be found on GitHub. With this tool, you can now trust the results of LLMs without having to manually fact-check them. 

In conclusion, SAFE is an excellent solution to the accuracy issues that have plagued LLMs. It allows you to trust the results of LLMs without having to manually fact-check them, saving you valuable time and effort. So why not try it out today and see how it can improve your workflow?
meta_desc: Fact-checking system SAFE developed by DeepMind's AI team can automatically verify LLM responses. This AI-based tool compares LLM results with human fact-checkers, achieving a 72% match in 16,000 tests. The code for SAFE is available on GitHub, making it accessible to anyone. Trust the results of LLMs without the need for manual fact-checking with SAFE. Try it today and improve your workflow.

post_title: BiaTech Joins NVIDIA Inception
title:
Cleaning Instructions:

BiaTech Corporation, a multisensory AI fusion startup, has joined NVIDIA Inception, a program that supports startups revolutionizing industries with technological advancements.

BiaTech Corporation is a cutting-edge startup that combines sensors replicating sight, hearing, and smell to create semi-sentient infrastructure and an immersive experience to interact with assets in real-time. BiaTech utilizes AI computer vision, multi-sensory AI fusion, and generative AI large language models and a text-to-speech interface. Early products targeted asset protection from wildfires and live monitoring of energy flow in a 3D visual environment for geothermal and utilities for production optimization. (Photo: Business Wire)

BiaTech plans to leverage the resources available through NVIDIA Inception, including product developer training, preferred pricing on NVIDIA hardware and software, cloud credits, and access to NVIDIA's investor network for its current pre-seed funding round, to accelerate its product development from prototype to commercial readiness. The program will also offer BiaTech the opportunity to collaborate with industry-leading experts and other AI-driven organizations.

Joining NVIDIA Inception is a milestone for BiaTech as it transitions from ideation to building a business that the world needs now. This is about helping clients bring affordable clean energy to everyone by using BiaTech's innovative AI toolkit, now available. BiaTech is collaborating with NVIDIA to help clients create the trillion-dollar industries of tomorrow.

NVIDIA Inception supports startups during critical stages of product development, prototyping, and deployment. Every NVIDIA Inception member receives a custom set of ongoing benefits, such as NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute credits, preferred pricing on NVIDIA hardware and software, and technology assistance, which provides startups with the fundamental tools they need to help them grow.

In conclusion, BiaTech Corporation's collaboration with NVIDIA Inception is an essential step towards creating a sustainable future. By leveraging NVIDIA's resources and expertise, BiaTech can accelerate its product development, promote clean energy, and help clients create the industries of the future.

post_title: Microsoft launches new Azure AI tools to cut out LLM safety and reliability risks
title: Keeping AI Applications Secure with Microsoft's New Azure AI Tools: Addressing Prompt Injection Attacks and Ensuring Reliability
post_content:
Title: Keeping AI Applications Secure with Microsoft's New Azure AI Tools

In today's world, the growing demand for generative AI has brought with it concerns about its safe and reliable deployment. As enterprises look to integrate AI into their operations, they need to ensure that the large language model (LLM) applications they develop deliver outputs of the highest quality without veering into unknown territories.

Enter Microsoft, which has just announced the launch of new Azure AI tools designed to address these concerns. The company's offerings are currently being previewed and are expected to become broadly available in the coming months.

Prompt Injection Attacks and Microsoft's Solution

One of the most significant challenges associated with LLMs is the problem of prompt injection attacks. These attacks occur when an attacker changes the input prompt of the model in such a way as to bypass the model's normal operations, including safety controls, and manipulate it to reveal personal or harmful content, compromising security or privacy.

To address this problem, Microsoft has introduced Prompt Shields to Azure AI. This comprehensive capability uses advanced machine learning (ML) algorithms and natural language processing to automatically analyze prompts and third-party data for malicious intent and block them from reaching the model.

Prompt Shields will integrate with three AI offerings from Microsoft: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Content Safety, and Azure AI Studio. It will also include a new feature called "Groundedness Detection," which uses a fine-tuned, custom language model to detect hallucinations or inaccurate material in text outputs produced by the model.

Focus on Reliability and Stress Testing

In addition to addressing prompt injection attacks, Microsoft has introduced tooling to focus on the reliability of gen AI apps. This includes prebuilt templates for safety-centric system messages and a new feature called "Groundedness Detection."

The former allows developers to build system messages that guide the model's behavior toward safe, responsible, and data-grounded outputs. The latter uses a fine-tuned, custom language model to detect hallucinations or inaccurate material in text outputs produced by the model.

Both features will be coming to Azure AI Studio and the Azure OpenAI Service. Furthermore, Microsoft has introduced automated evaluations to stress test the gen AI app for risk and safety. These evalu
meta_desc:
Title: Ensuring Reliability and Safety of AI Applications with Microsoft's New Azure AI Tools

Meta Description: Microsoft's Azure AI tools are designed to address prompt injection attacks and ensure the reliability and safety of generative AI applications. With Prompt Shields, developers can automatically analyze prompts and third-party data for malicious intent and block them from reaching the model. Azure AI tools also include prebuilt templates for safety-centric system messages and a new feature called "Groundedness Detection," which uses a fine-tuned language model to detect hallucinations or inaccurate material in text outputs. Automated evaluations are also included to stress test the AI app for risk and safety.

post_title: AI21 Labs juices up gen AI transformers with Jamba
title: "Revolutionary AI Model Jamba Combines SSM and Transformers for Generative Reasoning"
post_content:
Join us in Atlanta on April 10th and explore the world of security workforce. We will delve into the advantages of AI for security teams. Request an invite now.

Transformers have dominated the generative AI landscape since their introduction in 2017, but AI21 Labs' new approach, Jamba, offers a unique solution. Jamba combines the Mamba model, which is based on the Structured State Space model (SSM), along with a transformer architecture to create an optimized gen AI model. Jamba is designed to bring the best attributes of SSM and transformers together. The model is being released as an open-source under the Apache 2.0 license.

While Jamba may not replace current transformer-based large language models (LLM) today, it will likely be a complement in certain areas. Jamba has outperformed traditional transformer-based models on generative reasoning tasks, as measured by benchmarks such as HellaSwag. However, it does not yet outperform transformer-based models on critical benchmarks such as the Massive Multitask Language Understanding (MMLU) for problem-solving.

AI21 Labs has a particular focus on generative AI for enterprise use cases. The company raised $155 million in August 2023 to support its growing efforts. AI21 Labs' enterprise tools include Wordtune, an optimized service that helps enterprises generate content that matches an organization's tone and brand. The company often competes and wins against AI giant OpenAI for enterprise business.

To date, AI21 Labs' LLM technology has relied on the transformer architecture, just like every other LLM. However, Jamba is different, as it is a hybrid SSM and transformer model. The research team at AI21 Labs has identified several shortcomings with transformers, including slow inference for long context windows and a large memory footprint requirement for scaling transformers. The SSM approach, on the other hand, is designed to handle large context windows and reduce memory usage.

Jamba offers several advantages over traditional transformer-based models. For example, it has a 256K context window and can deliver 3x throughput on long contexts compared to Mixtral 8x7B. Additionally, Jamba uses a Mixture of Exper
meta_desc: Join us in Atlanta on April 10th and learn about the advantages of AI for security teams. Discover how Jamba, a new approach combines the Mamba model with transformer architecture to create an optimized gen AI model. Request an invite now.

post_title: Nine crypto VCs on why Q1 investments were so hot and how it compares to previous bull market
title: 2024 Crypto VC Investment Boost: Q1 Funding Up 25%
post_content:
The 2024 Crypto VC Landscape: A Hot Start to the Year

The first quarter of 2024 has seen a surge in investment in the cryptocurrency and blockchain sectors, with a total of $2.52 billion raised across both sectors. This represents a 25% increase over the same period in 2023, according to PitchBook data. The cryptocurrency venture capital landscape has been heating up, with deals becoming more active and founders having greater leverage in fundraising.

One reason for this surge in activity is the positive effects of legal wins from Ripple and Grayscale, as well as positive sentiments around decentralized finance (DeFi) on the Solana network. Additionally, demand is increasing for the biggest cryptocurrency post-SEC spot bitcoin ETF approvals in the US. The market has also seen institutional interest start to convert into real budgets and products, such as BlackRock launching a tokenized money market fund on the Ethereum blockchain.

In general, the crypto startup deal flow has picked up in areas ranging from DeFi to SocialFi to Bitcoin layer-2 growth. SocialFi, which refers to decentralized social media, is currently very hot, with companies like Bi.social and Mask Network hitting significant fundraising milestones. Web3 gaming is also rapidly expanding, with hundreds of new games expected to go to market later this year. Crypto and AI, blockchains, and anything zero-knowledge related are also "red-hot right now," according to Tom Schmidt, a partner at Dragonfly Capital.

Despite a significant year-over-year decrease in both VC and crypto funding in 2023, around 65%, there is a noticeable uptick in deal-making activity. This is due to a combination of factors, including the positive effects of legal wins, institutional interest, and the macro validation from crypto.

The crypto venture capital landscape has become more competitive, with founders having greater leverage in fundraising. This has created an environment in which investors are now reverse-pitching their value, meaning that some investors have to show founders why they should choose them. Founders now have optionality and the ability to set terms, with competitive rounds filling out before investors have time for intensive due diligence.

Overall, the first quarter of 2024 has seen a strong start to the year for the cryptocurrency and blockchain sectors, and this trend is expected to continue in the coming months. With institutional interest and macro validation from crypto, the crypto venture capital landscape will continue to heat up, providing opportunities for both investors and founders.
meta_desc: Meta Description: Investment in cryptocurrency and blockchain sectors surges in 2024, with $2.52 billion raised in Q1 and a 25% increase over 2023. Legal wins, institutional interest, and positive sentiments around decentralized finance (DeFi) are driving the market. Crypto startup deal flow is picking up in areas like DeFi, SocialFi, and Bitcoin layer-2 growth. The crypto venture capital landscape has become more competitive, with founders now having greater leverage in fundraising.

The U.K. government has been eager to position itself at the forefront of the AI revolution, driven by initiatives such as the AI Safety Summit and R&D investment, with DeepMind serving as one of the U.K.'s greatest AI exports. Hassabis, a prodigy in multiple disciplines, founded DeepMind out of London in 2010 and has led the company to some high-profile achievements, including developing an AI system that beat the world champion of strategy board game Go. His knighthood recognizes his contributions to the field of AI and his role in accelerating its growth and development.

post_title: Q&A: How to train AI when you don't have enough data
title: How to train AI with limited data?
post_content:
Artificial intelligence is an impressive technology that can analyze and detect patterns in large amounts of data. However, these machine learning algorithms require extensive training with vast amounts of data to achieve accuracy and effectiveness.

Researchers are constantly exploring new applications for AI, but they often run into scenarios where there isn't enough data to accurately train their algorithms. One such example is the analysis of X-ray images to detect rare conditions or the identification of a rare fish species caught on a commercial fishing boat.

Jenq-Neng Hwang, a University of Washington professor of electrical and computer engineering, has expertise in these areas. His team recently developed an algorithm that teaches AI to monitor how many distinct poses a baby can achieve throughout the day. This was a challenging task due to the limited training datasets of babies, which required the team to create a unique pipeline to ensure their algorithm's accuracy and usefulness.

The team presented their work at the IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision 2024, and their research is available on the arXiv preprint server. UW News spoke with Hwang about the project details and other similarly challenging areas the team is addressing.

One example of where AI is particularly well-suited is in tracking baby poses. Hwang and his team collaborated with the UW School of Medicine and the Korean Electronics and Telecommunications Research Institute's AI Lab to develop an algorithm to help families with a history of autism identify whether their babies were also likely to have autism.

However, it's challenging to determine if a baby is autistic before they are nine months old, as they don't have language skills at that age. The team developed a test called the Alberta Infant Motor Scale, which categorizes various poses babies can do. If a baby can do a specific pose, they receive points, and the total points are added up to determine if the baby is likely to have autism.

But using a doctor to observe all the different poses is a tedious process that can take several hours. One solution could be to use AI. Parents often have a baby monitor at home, which could use AI to continuously and consistently track the various poses a baby does in a day.

AI is particularly well-suited for this task because it can learn from vast amounts of data, making it an ideal choice for tracking baby poses. The team developed a pipeline that used a large amount of 3D motion sequences of regular people to train a generic 3D pose generative AI model, which was similar to the model used in ChatGPT and other GPT-4 types of large language models.

However, the limited amount of annotated baby motion sequences made it difficult to finetune the model. The team had to develop a unique pipeline that combined the generic model with their small dataset of annotated baby motion sequences. The generic model was able to adapt to the small dataset and produce high-quality results.

In conclusion, AI is an excellent tool for analyzing large amounts of data and detecting patterns or trends. However, these machine learning algorithms require extensive training with vast amounts of data to achieve accuracy and effectiveness. Researchers are constantly exploring new applications for AI, but they often run into scenarios where there isn't enough data to accurately train their algorithms.
meta_desc:
Improve search engine visibility with this Meta Description:

Discover how AI can track baby poses and detect autism in infants. Researchers at the University of Washington developed a pipeline that uses AI to monitor a baby's poses throughout the day. With the help of AI, parents can track baby poses and identify potential signs of autism in infants. The team's work was presented at the IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision 2024, and the research is available on the arXiv preprint server.

post_title: Byju's founder makes last-ditch attempt to placate disgruntled investors
title: Byju's Founder's Last-Ditch Attempt to Quell Investor Discontent
post_content:
The Tumultuous Times of Byju's: A Test of Resilience and Investor Relations

In the dynamic world of startups, few tales are as compelling as the recent developments at Byju's, the Indian edtech giant once hailed as the country's most valuable startup. The company's founder, Byju Raveendran, finds himself at a critical juncture, navigating through a storm of investor discontent and legal challenges that threaten the very fabric of his enterprise.

The Crux of the Crisis

At the heart of the matter lies a contentious rights issue, a financial maneuver initiated by Byju's in a bid to raise much-needed capital. This move, however, has sparked a fierce backlash from key investors, leading to a standoff that could see their stakes significantly diluted. The rights issue, typically a lifeline for companies, has instead become a battleground, with investors like Prosus Ventures, Peak XV, and the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative opting out and subsequently engaging in legal action to safeguard their interests.

A Founder's Plea for Unity

In a recent communication to shareholders, Raveendran made an impassioned plea for solidarity, emphasizing his commitment to equality and his vision of collective progress. Despite the adversarial climate, he remains hopeful of securing the necessary support to enact the rights issue, thereby securing Byju's financial future.

The Boardroom Shuffle

The dispute has already seen its share of drama, with high-profile resignations from Byju's board and a notable departure of Deloitte as the company's auditor. These events underscore the governance concerns that have plagued Byju's, further complicating its path to resolution.

A Strategy Under Scrutiny

Byju's ambitious expansion strategy, marked by a flurry of acquisitions during the pandemic, has come under intense scrutiny. The company's aggressive growth plans, once seen as a sign of its bold vision, now appear to some as overreach, particularly in light of the global economic shifts precipitated by geopolitical tensions.

A Founder's Reflection

Raveendran acknowledges the missteps along the way and seeks a chance to recalibrate Byju's trajectory. His personal investment in the company's success is undeniable, and he remains hopeful that his backers will continue to share in the journey, despite the current turbulence.

Looking Ahead

As Byju's braces for the upcoming court date and the final verdict on the rights issue, the tech world watches with bated breath. The outcome of this saga will not only shape the future of Byju's but also serve as a case study in investor relations and crisis management in the startup ecosystem.

post_title: Unleashing disordered rocksalt oxides as cathodes for rechargeable magnesium batteries
title: Scientists at Tohoku University develop new cathode material for rechargeable magnesium batteries, promising higher capacity and efficiency.
post_content:
Are you tired of constantly worrying about charging your phone or laptop? Do you wish you could store more energy in a smaller package? Well, scientists at Tohoku University have developed a new cathode material that could revolutionize rechargeable magnesium batteries (RMBs) and make them more affordable, safer, and higher in capacity.

The new material, which leverages an enhanced rock-salt structure, promises to enable efficient charging and discharging even at low temperatures. This innovative material also addresses a key limitation of RMBs—the difficulty of magnesium (Mg) transport within solid materials.

The researchers at Tohoku University introduced a strategic mixture of seven different metallic elements to create a crystal structure abundant in stable cation vacancies, facilitating easier Mg insertion and extraction. This is the first utilization of rocksalt oxide as a cathode material for RMBs.

The high-entropy strategy employed by the researchers allowed the cation defects to activate the rocksalt oxide cathode. The material developed by Tohoku University researchers operates efficiently at just 90°C, demonstrating a significant reduction in the required operating temperature.

This breakthrough is a major step forward in the quest for efficient, eco-friendly energy storage solutions. It opens up new possibilities for various applications, including grid storage, electric vehicles, and portable electronic devices. By harnessing the intrinsic benefits of magnesium and overcoming previous material limitations, this research paves the way for the next generation of batteries, promising significant impacts on technology, the environment, and society.

So, if you're looking for a new, efficient, and cost-effective alternative to lithium-ion batteries, keep an eye on the magnesium batteries featuring the newly developed cathode material.
meta_desc: Looking for an efficient and cost-effective alternative to lithium-ion batteries? Tohoku University researchers have developed a new cathode material for rechargeable magnesium batteries (RMBs) that promises to revolutionize the energy storage industry. By leveraging an enhanced rock-salt structure and strategic metallic elements, the new material enables efficient charging and discharging at low temperatures, even at 90°C. This breakthrough is a major step forward in the quest for eco-friendly energy storage solutions and opens up new possibilities for various applications, including grid storage, electric vehicles, and portable electronic devices. This innovation paves the way for the next generation of batteries, promising significant impacts on technology, the environment, and society. Keep an eye on the magnesium batteries featuring the new cathode material for efficient and cost-effective energy storage.
focuskeywords: Keyphrase: "Disordered rocksalt oxides as rechargeable magnesium batteries."

post_title: X's Grok chatbot will soon get an upgraded model, Grok-1.5
post_content:
The Dawn of Grok-1.5: A Leap Forward in Generative AI

In the ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, a new chapter unfolds with the introduction of Grok-1.5, the latest generative AI model from X.ai. This innovative tool is poised to revolutionize the way we interact with social networks, bringing a new level of sophistication to chatbot technology.

A Glimpse into the Future

The anticipation is palpable as Grok-1.5 is set to enhance the social network X's user experience in the imminent future. This advanced model promises to surpass its predecessor, Grok-1, in both performance and capabilities, as evidenced by its impressive benchmark results.

Enhanced Cognitive Capabilities

Grok-1.5 boasts significant improvements in reasoning, particularly in tasks related to coding and mathematics. It has achieved remarkable scores, more than doubling Grok-1's performance in the MATH benchmark and excelling in the HumanEval test, which evaluates programming language generation and problem-solving skills.

Predicting Practical Performance

While benchmarks offer a glimpse of potential, the true test lies in real-world application. AI benchmarks, often focusing on niche academic challenges, may not fully represent everyday interactions. However, Grok-1.5's advancements suggest a promising translation of these results into practical usage.

Expanding Contextual Understanding

A standout feature of Grok-1.5 is its ability to process an extensive range of context—up to 128,000 tokens. This expanded context window allows the model to retain information from longer conversations and documents, ensuring a more coherent and informed interaction.

Breaking Boundaries

X.ai's Grok series has been known for tackling topics that other models typically avoid, including controversial political ideas and conspiracies. Grok-1.5 continues this tradition, potentially responding with a touch of rebellion or even blunt language, reflecting the unique approach that sets it apart.

Availability and New Horizons

Grok-1.5 will soon be accessible to early testers on the social network X, bringing with it a suite of new features. While specifics remain under wraps, the buzz around potential capabilities like summarizing discussions and content suggestions is growing.

Open Source Milestones and Accessibility

Following the open-sourcing of Grok-1, X.ai has hinted at broader availability of the Grok chatbot, particularly for subscribers of X's premium plans. This move democratizes access to cutting-edge AI, inviting a wider audience to experience the future of digital interaction.

Conclusion: Embracing the AI Revolution

As we stand on the cusp of a new era in AI, Grok-1.5 emerges as a beacon of progress. Its advanced reasoning, expanded context understanding, and bold approach to conversation mark a significant step forward in the journey towards more intelligent and dynamic chatbots.

post_title: The AI world needs more data transparency and web3 startup Space and Time says it can help
title: Verifiable Compute for AI: Space and Time's Solution
post_content:
In the rapidly evolving world of AI, ensuring transparency and data integrity has become more crucial than ever. This is where the web3 startup Space and Time comes in. Founded by Scott Dykstra, the company aims to provide a verifiable computing layer for web3, allowing for secure and tamper-proof data indexing both on-chain and off-chain.

Dykstra, the CTO and co-founder of the company, highlights the need for data transparency and verification in the wake of the FTX collapse. "We saw that during the FTX collapse," he said on TechCrunch's Chain Reaction podcast. "We had an organization that had some brand trust, like I had my personal life savings in FTX. I trusted them as a brand."

This issue transcends beyond FTX, into other industries, where financial institutions have an incentive to manipulate their records. However, Dykstra believes that the solution to this problem lies in verification of data and zero-knowledge proofs (ZK proofs). ZK proofs are cryptographic actions used to prove something about a piece of information without revealing the origin data itself.

At a high level, ZK proofs work by having two parties, the prover and the verifier, that confirm a statement is true without conveying any information more than whether it's correct. For example, if I wanted to know whether someone's credit score was above 700, if there's one in place, a ZK proof can confirm that to the verifier, without actually disclosing the exact number.

Space and Time's ultimate goal is to be that verifiable computing layer for web3, indexing data both off-chain and on-chain. Currently, the startup has indexed from major blockchains like Ethereum, Bitcoin, Polygon, Sui, Avalanche, Sei, and Aptos and is adding support for more chains to power the future of AI and blockchain technology.

However, Dykstra's most recent concern is that AI data isn't really verifiable. "I'm pretty concerned that we're not really efficiently ever going to be able to verify that an LLM was executed correctly," he said.

To solve this issue, teams today are working on building ZK proofs for machine learning or large language models (LLMs), but it can
meta_desc: Verify data securely and transparently with ZK proofs for AI. Ensure data integrity and protection with Space and Time's verifiable computing layer. Secure data indexing both on-chain and off-chain.
focuskeywords: The keyphrase for this news article is: ZK proofs for AI data transparency.

post_title: Meet Palmsy, the fake social network where your posts stay on your device forever
title: The Palmsy App: A Social Media Methadone for the Trapped Individual
post_content:
Title: The Palmsy App: A Social Media Methadone for the Trapped Individual

Introduction:

In today's digital world, social media has become an integral part of our lives. Whether it's Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other platform, the addiction to these networks can be overwhelming. That's where Palmsy comes in. Palmsy is a new app that aims to help individuals who are struggling with social media addiction by providing them with a safe space to post anything they want without the fear of judgment.

Body:

When you sign up to a new social network, you have zero friends, zero followers, and zero likes. But as you start posting content, you might get more and more likes and comments. That could lead to new followers. And that dopamine boost will encourage you to post even more. Palmsy is trying to act as social media methadone by letting you post anything and get likes on them.

The catch is that no one can see the posts. You can publish as many posts as you like, and the app even lets you add photos to your posts. But you're sending those posts into the void. Developer Pat Nakajima said on Threads that no post leaves your device, and all likes are fake.

The free app works on both iPhone and iPad, and it essentially reads your contact list to assign pretend likes to posts. While the app is reading your contact details, because all posts are local, contact information is not sent to a server.

"It can be fun to see Likes coming in from folks you haven't thought about in years," Nakajima writes in the FAQ section of the app. "It can also be useful in maybe deleting some contacts you might not need anymore."

Beyond looking at contacts, you can treat the app as a personal diary or even a place to get bad puns out of your system - nobody is going to judge you. It's up to you.

The developer recently updated the app with some advanced options that let you limit the number of likes on a particular post and for how long you want those likes to come in: a few seconds, a few minutes, a few hours, or a few days.

There have been multiple time-limiting apps that try to help when it comes to reducing social media addiction. Some developers have also released very basic apps to post dumb
meta_desc:
Meta Description:

Overcome social media addiction and find a safe space to express yourself with Palmsy, the unique app that lets you post anything without fear of judgment. With its focus on safety and self-expression, Palmsy is an excellent resource for those who need a break from the pressures of social media. Try Palmsy today and take the first step towards personal growth and well-being.

post_title: How Uber and the gig economy changed the way we live and work
title: Gig economy's impact on work and employment: benefits and challenges
post_content:
gig plan was nothing more than a pipe dream, a fleeting glimpse into a future in which the company could eliminate its biggest expense: the human-powered vehicles that made up its core business model. But even as Uber's ambitions grew, its reputation as a rogue corporate entity only deepened. To this day, it remains one of the most controversial and widely detested companies in the gig economy.

But despite the darkness surrounding Uber's past, it's worth taking a step back and considering the broader implications of the gig economy as a whole. The rise of platform-based work has transformed the traditional notion of self-employment, making it easier than ever for people to earn a living gig by gig. At the same time, this new form of work has also brought with it a host of challenges and risks, from the uncertainty of income to the lack of benefits and protections for workers.

One of the most significant challenges facing gig workers is the ongoing debate over their employment status. While companies like Uber and Lyft insist that their workers are independent contractors, many argue that they should be classified as employees in order to receive benefits and protections such as minimum wage, overtime pay, and workers' compensation. This issue has sparked a number of high-profile legal battles, with gig companies fighting tooth and nail to maintain their current business model.

Another key challenge facing gig workers is the erosion of traditional career paths. As more people turn to gig work as a way to make ends meet, there's a risk that the traditional career ladder will become increasingly irrelevant. This could lead to a more fluid and flexible labor market, with workers able to easily switch between different gigs and industries. But it could also lead to a lack of stability and security for workers, as they struggle to build a long-term career in a world where gig work is the norm.

Despite these challenges, the gig economy has also brought with it a number of benefits. For example, the rise of platform-based work has made it easier than ever for people to earn a living doing something they love. It has also created new opportunities for entrepreneurs and small business owners, who can use gig marketplaces to reach a global customer base.

In conclusion, the gig economy represents a major shift in the way we think about work and employment. While it has brought with it a number of challenges and risks, it has also created new opportunities for people
meta_desc: Work in the gig economy? Consider the benefits and drawbacks of flexible work and find a balance that works for you. Learn more about the challenges facing gig workers and the potential benefits of this new form of work.

post_title: How a tiny 4-person startup, Supaglue, caught Stripe’s eye
title: "Stripe Acqui-Hires Four-Person Team from Supaglue to Boost RFA Unit"
post_content:
Stripe's annual letter highlights the company's focus on fast-growing areas, including the "Revenue and Finance Automation" unit. This team helps businesses manage billing, tax, and revenue recognition. Stripe's RFA unit is expected to reach a $500 million annual run rate this year. To support this growth, the company completed an "acqui-hire" of a four-person team from Supaglue, an open-source developer platform for user-facing integrations. This team will help accelerate Stripe's real-time analytics and reporting across its platform and third-party apps for the RFA suite.

Supaglue was founded in 2021 by George Xing and Thomas Chen, who worked on the data teams at Lyft and Uber. The company realized that managing data and business metrics across teams was inconsistent and fragmented, which could lead to bad decisions and even worse business outcomes. Supaglue built a product that helps companies import and centralize customer data from third-party data sources like Salesforce or other customer relationship management systems into their own applications.

What caught the attention of Stripe? Mutual work acquaintances introduced Supaglue, and the two companies began having conversations. Stripe offered to buy Supaglue because it was also doing a fair amount of integration work. Supaglue's product is similar to a big part of the RFA suite, which is a unified data platform that reconciles data from each of its products and surfaces relevant insights to the end users of Stripe via dashboards, alerts, customer reporting, and real-time analytics.

Stripe has been busy this year, with employee stock sale deals, partnerships with companies like authentication startup Clerk, and an electric boat startup Navier. The Supaglue acqui-hire is one of many things going on at Stripe, and it is likely to quickly find fast friends within Stripe's ecosystem. Overall, Stripe's focus on fast-growing areas and its investment in Supaglue show its commitment to providing businesses with the tools they need to succeed in today's market.
meta_desc: "Boost your Revenue and Finance Automation with Stripe's Acquisition of Supaglue" - Optimize your business operations with Stripe's unified data platform that centralizes customer data and provides real-time analytics. Quickly make data-driven decisions to boost revenue and improve your financial performance. Start today with Stripe.

post_title: Google Podcasts is shutting down soon, users urged to move to YouTube Music
title: New SEO Title: [Move to YouTube Music: Google Podcasts App Shutting Down]
post_content:
Podcast Lovers, Beware: Google to Shutdown Its Podcasts App Soon

In a shocking announcement, Google has revealed that it will be shutting down its popular Podcasts app in the US in the coming days. To make the transition as smooth as possible, users will need to migrate their subscriptions to YouTube Music by April 2, 2024. 

The Google Podcasts app, which has been downloaded over 500 million times on Android devices worldwide, has been a go-to destination for podcast enthusiasts. The app offered a simple and user-friendly interface for discovering, following, and listening to podcasts, as well as tools to add podcasts via RSS feed. Unfortunately, the tech giant has decided to wind down the Podcasts app as part of its broader plan to centralize its audio services under YouTube.

Google Podcasts app was first launched in 2018, and despite its popularity, it remained a separate entity from YouTube Music until late 2023. YouTube Music was able to support podcasts globally by the end of 2023 and had the ability to upload their RSS feeds in February.

The move to shift podcasting to YouTube could help Google become a bigger player in the space, not only by merging its efforts and sharpening its focus but also because interest in video podcasts, which were already popular on YouTube, is on the rise. For instance, Spotify announced a deal with Universal Music Group (UMG) this week to bring video podcasts to U.S. users of its streaming app.

Bleeping Computer was the first to notice the shutdown date for Google Podcasts in the US, and a support page on Google's site confirms that users in the US will only be able to use the Podcasts app through the end of March 2024. Users who miss the in-app pop-ups can still export their subscriptions through July 2024.

Google did not immediately respond to a request for comment, but after publication, they confirmed that while they are still "tracking towards" the April 2 timeline for the US, they have not shared a timeline for the rest of the world yet.

From earlier statements, it is clear that the plan is to discontinue Google Podcasts globally in 2024. 

So, podcast lovers, it's time to start searching for a new podcasting platform.
meta_desc:
the Podcasts app through the end of March 2024. Users who miss the in-app pop-ups can still export their subscriptions through July 2024.

Google did not immediately respond to a request for comment, but after publication, they confirmed that while they are still "tracking towards" the April 2 timeline for the US, they have not shared a timeline for the rest of the world yet. From earlier statements, it is clear that the plan is to discontinue Google Podcasts globally in 2024.

So, podcast lovers, it's time to start searching for a new podcasting platform. The YouTube Music app offers a more comprehensive podcasting experience, with a wider selection of podcasts and a user-friendly interface. Other popular podcasting platforms include Apple Podcasts, Spotify, and Google's own Google Podcasts app (outside the US).

Don't miss out on your favorite podcasts! Start exploring new platforms today and ensure you don't miss a beat.

post_title: Microsoft Copilot has reportedly been blocked on all Congress-owned devices
title: Microsoft Copilot Blocked on Congress-Owned Devices
post_content:
In recent news, Congressional staff members can no longer use Microsoft's Copilot on their government-issued devices, as per a memo obtained by Axios. The Office of Cybersecurity has deemed Copilot to be a security risk, citing the threat of leaking House data to non-House approved cloud services. While there are no restrictions on using Copilot on personal phones and laptops, it will now be blocked on all Windows devices owned by the Congress.

This comes after a similar ban on the use of ChatGPT, a chatbot powered by OpenAI's large language models, on House computers was set last year. However, staffers were still allowed to use the paid version of ChatGPT (ChatGPT Plus) for research and evaluation due to its tighter privacy controls.

Recently, the White House issued rules for federal agencies to follow when it comes to generative AI, which would ensure that any tool they use does not endanger the rights and safety of Americans. Microsoft has recognized the need for higher security requirements and has announced a roadmap of tools and services meant for government use, including an Azure OpenAI service for classified workloads and a new version of Microsoft 365's Copilot assistant.

Szpindor's office will evaluate the government version Copilot when it becomes available before deciding if it can be used on House devices. While the ban on Copilot may seem restrictive, it is important to ensure the security of sensitive data and protect the privacy of Congressional staff members.
meta_desc: "Microsoft Copilot is no longer allowed on Congressional staff's government-issued devices due to security concerns. Follow the latest rules and guidelines for generative AI in the federal sector. Stay informed with the latest news and updates on AI."
focuskeywords: [start of generated content] Microsoft Copilot [end of generated content]

post_title: Orbit Fab unveils $30K port to refuel satellites
title: Orbit Fab's RAFTI: The Future of Space Refueling
post_content:
Title: Orbit Fab's RAFTI - The Future of Space Refueling

Introduction:

The space industry is rapidly evolving, and one of the most exciting developments in recent years is the emergence of companies like Orbit Fab. This startup is revolutionizing the way we think about space propulsion by creating orbital gas stations, or "gas cap" systems, for satellites. In this article, we'll explore how Orbit Fab is leveraging its innovative technology to provide a unique and valuable service to the space industry.

Body:

Orbit Fab's Rapidly Attachable Fluid Transfer Interface (RAFTI) is a game-changer in the world of space exploration. This docking mechanism is designed to transfer propellant from an orbital tanker to a customer spacecraft, providing an efficient and cost-effective solution for refueling satellites in orbit. The RAFTI is now flight-qualified and available on the market, with each port priced at just $30,000.

The idea for the RAFTI began with Orbit Fab CEO and co-founder Daniel Faber, who has been working in the space industry for decades. As part of his previous work at Deep Space Industries, Faber developed satellite thrusters for orbital maneuvering. This experience led him to believe that the next big opportunity in the space industry was in-space refueling.

The potential revenue generated from extra kilograms of propellant is significant in the space industry. Faber notes that spacecraft are optimized with the amount of fuel they have, and when they run out, an extra kilogram of propellant could generate a million dollars in marginal revenue. This is why Orbit Fab saw the need for orbital gas stations to complement existing satellite servicing capabilities.

Orbit Fab's technology is ambitious, but the architecture is relatively simple. The company sells two products: fuel and fueling ports. The RAFTI can also be used to fuel spacecraft on the ground prior to launch. Once a RAFTI-equipped satellite runs out of propellant, one of Orbit Fab's tankers can pick up some fuel from orbital depots and deliver it straight to the customer's satellite for refueling.

However, developing the RAFTI was no easy task. There are many variables to consider, including cost, impact on the customer spacecraft, and compliance with standards from NASA, the Space Force, and the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics. Faber notes that nailing each part of the hardware was critical, and it took years to ensure the RAFTI met all the necessary requirements.

Conclusion:

Orbit Fab's RAFTI is a revolutionary concept that has the potential to transform the space industry. With the increasing demand for satellite services, the need for efficient and cost-effective refueling solutions has never been greater. The RAFTI is a testament to Orbit Fab's innovative spirit and commitment to providing value to the space industry. As the first RAFTI-equipped satellites go to orbit later this year, we can expect to see the beginning of a new era in space exploration.
meta_desc: Looking for an efficient and cost-effective solution for refueling satellites in orbit? Orbit Fab's Rapidly Attachable Fluid Transfer Interface (RAFTI) is the answer. This docking mechanism allows for easy transfer of propellant from an orbital tanker to a customer spacecraft, providing a valuable service to the space industry. With each port priced at just $30,000, the RAFTI is a game-changer in the world of space exploration.
